Matter is used to describe what things are made of .
A liger is a cross between a lion and a camel.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct:
A liger is a cross between a male lion and a female tiger.

questionsData.title: Square, curved and round are examples of shapes.
" Holiday" means "not being at work".
We use kilometers to measure distance .
Sound is created by something vibrating.
We see things by refraction.

questionsData.explain_answer: The Richter scale is a scale used to measure  the strength of earthquakes .

questionsData.title: Rescue teams are those who neglect people in danger.
"Recklessly" means "carelessly".
Cowpox is a disease that affects cattle.
"Vacancies" means "unfilled job.
The layout is the text design .
A person who applies for a job is an applicant.
Blueberry is a kind of disease.
Things you use in cooking are ingredients.
You have to squeeze lemon before you drink it.
The moon gets its light from the sun.
The cabin is a small house in which you live.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Cabin (ship) a small, enclosed room on a ship used for passengers or crew.
May have beds, furniture, and storage space.
Not a permanent residence, but provides living quarters for a journey.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………………….
questionsData.article: Tears usually show how you feel. When you're unhappy, tears roll down on your cheeks, Sometime tears drop from your eyes when you are happy, or if you laugh very hard. But tears have a more important job than showing how you feel. All day long your eyes sit in a bath of tears. These tears keep your eyes clean and healthy. They wash away dirt and germs and other things that get into your eyes. Your eyes also need tears to keep them wet. Your eyes must be wet so that they can move smoothly. If they didn’t move smoothly, you'd have to turn your head to look at things that weren't right in front of you. If you didn’t have tears, your eyes couldn't move and soon you would be blind. Under each eyelid are tiny sacs called tear glands. That's where tears are made, Generally your eyes can’t do without tears. All day long tears wash your eyes to keep them

questionsData.title: We don't have ….. time to finish the assignment.
Salwa is the same ….. as me.
The old system was difficult, ….. the new system is easy.
Ali is ….. with his work .
questionsData.explain_answer:
The general rule: [Subject] + [be verb] + [verb in simple past form]

Example: In the sentence "Ali is satisfied with his work," the general rule is applied as follows:
[Ali] + [is] + [satisfied].

satisfy : is a verb so we can not use it after "is".
Satisfying : is an adjective that describes something that brings satisfaction.
​​​​​​​Satisfaction : is a noun that refers to the state of being satisfied.

questionsData.title: I smelt the food …….
Listen! The teacher is …..
The new hospital ….. last year by the minister.
Ali is the teacher ….. travelled to London.
…… he is a famous football player, he is always busy
I look forward to ….. from you soon.
I am interested ………... speaking English.
The higher the temperature, the ….. dangerous the disease.
While I was sleeping , she …….. the door.
The suffix ……. changes the word "happy " into an adverb.
22nd of May is a national day. The word "national " is a/an …..
Of the following, only ……..… is a compound word.
Have someone ….. with you.
My grandfather wishes he …… a farm.
questionsData.explain_answer:
My grandfather wishes he had a farm.

  • "Has" is used in the present tense, indicating possession or something that currently exists.
  • "Had" is used in the past perfect tense, which expresses a wish, regret, or hypothetical situation in the past.

In this sentence, your grandfather is expressing a wish about the past. He wishes that he had a farm at some point in the past. Therefore, "had" is the grammatically correct option.
